intro: Cypselea meziana, commonly known as the Mexican thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage is gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small, purple to pink flowers during the summer months. Cypselea meziana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
